instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message:
NTO board only
occasional green light
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  8.18
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.18
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.18
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 15.08
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 2.9-3.2
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>   3.1-3.4
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>   0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>   0
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL>   0

replaced <RESISTOR>R6128</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R6121</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R6127</RESISTOR> <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> seems a bit low, also PP3V42 should be stable, I guess this is liquid damage, could be corrosion under SMC....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 16466"]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> seems a bit low, also PP3V42 should be stable, I guess this is liquid damage, could be corrosion under SMC....[/QUOTE]

widespread liquid damage, none in smc area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message: smc reset probably fucked, or jtag

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message: I remove every jtag that comes in, will check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> when I have another go at it, I've already marked it as not fixable, customer donated the whole laptop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message: PPBUS is too low so probably SMC not running. Dead SMC or crap under/near it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from the dead pile, any ideas?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 16540"]PPBUS is too low so probably SMC not running. Dead SMC or crap under/near it.[/QUOTE]

thanks for the reply, I will try again when there isnt 10 jobs waiting
